All Reviews

  1. I have been using this eye cream for about half a year now. I have oily and combination skin and my skin around my eyes is very sensitive. When i use those high end very rich eye creams, I will have little white bumps under my eyes. This eye cream is very hydrating and it does not have any strong smell to it. It absorbs quickly and easily applied evenly. I have recommended this product to all my girl friends, and they love it too. A little bit goes a long way, with the pump it is easy to control the amount you need each time. I use it day and night with gentle massage, less fine lines and my eye concealer applies better too.

  5. I do like InstaNatural products as a whole. I do feel like this product helps eliminate my puffy eyes. I suffer from bad allergies. My eyes are usually puffy. Now my eyes feel more alert.<br /><br />There is one ingredient that I had to look up - Methylsulfonylmethane (I had to look this one up as I'm allergic to a lot of sulfates. MSM is a chemical found in plants, animals, and humans. People use it as a medicine. They don't have any sulfates in their products. I've had no reactions.<br /><br />This product was given to me for review. I'm a professional blogger that writes my true opinion.

  193. I occasionally have dark circles under my eyes. Part of this is because I don't always get enough sleep. However, part of it is because of the genetics of my family genetics. Personally, I've never found it to be that big of a deal, but when I had the opportunity to sample INSTANATURAL EYE CREAM FOR DARK CIRCLES, PUFFINESS, WRINKLES, AND BAGS, I couldn't pass it up. After only using the product for about a month, I noticed a large improvement in the condition of the skin beneath my eyes. The flesh looked more youthful and vibrant. The only negative about the product that I have is a minor one: the cream is a topical cream, but for something that has to be used so close to one's eyes, you have to be very careful not to accidently rub any of the cream into your eyes. Overall, I found the INSTANATURAL EYE CREAM FOR DARK CIRCLES, PUFFINESS, WRINKLES, AND BAGS to be quite effective and would recommend it to anyone looking to get rid of dark circles, puffiness, wrinkles, or bags around their eyes. I was provided a sample of this item from the manufacturer for examination and possible review.

I typically apply just before my face cream, and before finsihing my hair, so I have plenty of time for these both to dry before applying makeup. I don't experience any flaking or caking, either, with this product - it goes on well and stays on well.<br /><br />Within a few days, I saw a visible reduction of darkness under my eyes, and I wish now that I had taken photos to do a comparison. I used to need to dab makeup underneath my eyes to brighten them up, but now I don't need to.<br /><br />I haven't paid attention to wrinkle reduction...honestly, I bought the cream more for the dark circles, figuring when I'm in my late 70's, I'll have wondered why I even bothered trying to stop the wrinkles...they'll find me one way or another.

This helped a lot and now I use this product both day and night. I rub it in so that it's entirely blended into my skin and then put my regular facial cream over it. I have been using this for about a month now and already see that one of my larger wrinkles has almost entirely disappeared. Although the texture was bothering me, the product itself did do a nice job. I ended up topping it with a moisturizer to help get rid of the tacky feel and it stopped bothering me. My eyes did appear to be less dry and my makeup applied so much better the morning after using this. I highly suggest this if you don't mind the sticky feel. I did contact the company about my concern and they suggested that I use less of the product. It did help with the texture, but I'm someone that likes to pile on the product. These two gels are my new favs on days that I don't use retinol products. I usually use the gel at night, but yesterday I tried it during the day so I could try it under makeup. Once dry, I put my usual foundaion on. No balling or rubbing off at all. It's a terrific base for all of your makeup. I also put it on my eyelids, but only about 1/2 way down. I can't speak to using it all the way to my upper eyelashes as I never go that far with anything since lotions, etc. have a way of moving into my eyes over the course of a day or night. I also like very much that you get a full 1.7oz in this bottle. I've seen several bottles with similar ingredients with only 1 oz or even .5 oz so be sure to check the amount when ordering. The company is lovely to deal with. They have sent me emails with information on how to use the gel and even an offer for a free bottle of hyaluronic acid. Highly recommend, Time will tell on the wrinkle and other improvements. Update: I'm still using this eye gel, only for me it's strictly used all over my face except under my eyes. My reason for skipping this region is that at my age I need something with more moisture. I have found that when the eye gel dries under my eyes it pulls at that delicate skin and then when I move my eyes around once it's dry, that it kind of cracks and then highlights every fine line there. So I'll continue with it everywhere else as I really like how it makes my face feel, but will use something that is much more emollient under my eyes.

  718. Let me introduce you to the InstaNatural Youth Express Eye Gel. This product is a natural 75% organic gel formula that claims to provide 'absolute care to the eye area' and combats dark dark circles, puffiness,  and sagging skin. <br /><br />But does it really do all of those things? While I can't attest to the sagging skin claim, It does work wonders on the dark circles and puffy eyes. I applied,  dabbing and patting it, around my days twice daily. It also has a lovely mild cucumber scent.<br /><br />I have noticed a drastically large change in the puffiness.  The cool feeling on application is wonderful and kicks those tired looking eyes in the behind! And while I can't say it really got rid of the dark circles, it did seem to brighten up my eye area and make them a bit less noticible and much more refreshed looking.<br /><br />The absolute only complaint I have is that it does tend to leave a bit of a sticky feeling until it completly dries (i just used less product to combat that issue. Don't put a giant glob on your face!)<br /><br />Overall, I give this an 8/10. I'm not sure if I recommend this to anyone seeking products for advanced signs of aging,  but if your like me in the early stages I say this is a great product to keep you looking fresh and vibrant!!

  753. How do you compare the hundreds of skin care products? I'm a regular tester, so I've arrived at a list of key considerations. I hope these help you!<br /><br />~ Fragrance (does it smell good? Are there artificial fragrances?): Very slight, fresh cucumber-like scent. Cucumber hydrosol and aloe are two of the main base ingredients. No added fragrance.<br />~ Feel during application: Slippery and wet. Feels fresh and cooling, spreads well. One pump is enough for the whole face, not just eyes.<br />~ Feel after absorption (Soft? Oily? Sticky? Moist? Tight?): Very slightly tight, very slightly sticky (often the case with moisturizing ingredients like hyaluronic acid and glycerin), so would make a good mineral makeup primer if you put your makeup on just before it finishes absorbing.<br />~ Is it best for a certain skin type?: It doesn’t add oil or dry the skin. Should be neutral as to skin type. Doesn’t irritate my very sensitive skin.<br />~ Is it tested on animals?: No.<br />~ Immediate cosmetic effects:* Very slight brightening of skin (fresher look) and reduction in fine wrinkles. Cosmetic effect is mild.<br />~ Potential long-term effectiveness:* With Matryxl 3000, hyaluronic acid, peptides, herbal extracts, and amino acids, this has a number of very effective active ingredients. Plant stem cells, another main ingredient, don’t have much to show for themselves besides hype, but the others are good.<br /><br />*Know the difference between cosmetic and long-term effects: Cosmetic effects are immediate and only present when the product has been applied recently - just like makeup. Long-term effects take longer to see and should remain when you stop using the product (but don't when you find something effective - your skin needs continuing support). The ideal product would be both cosmetically and long-term effective, but it's more realistic to expect a formula to tilt towards one or the other.<br /><br />Other notes: The 1.7 ounce bottle is large and the gel spreads well. This is an excellent value, and I would suggest using it on your entire face, not just the eye area.<br /><br />I received this free or virtually so for product testing and review. I am under no obligation to provide a positive review and receive no incentives or rewards for doing so. My aim is to highlight features and drawbacks that I would want to know about as a buyer, not hype the product for the manufacturer. My remarks are sincere and my own.eads well. This is an excellent value, and I would suggest using it on your entire face, not just the eye area.<br /><br />I received this free or virtually so for product testing and review. I am under no obligation to provide a positive review and receive no incentives or rewards for doing so. My aim is to highlight features and drawbacks that I would want to know about as a buyer, not hype the product for the manufacturer. My remarks are sincere and my own.

  771. At the age of 30, I mostly use eye gels and creams as a prophylactic. I do however get puffy bags under my eyes sometimes when I don't get enough sleep (which is often). One of the first things that I noticed is that although this gel says it is an eye gel, the directions say you can use it on your face. It can be used under makeup. As soon as I learned this, I cleaned my face and proceeded to slather on the gel. It feels slightly sticky at first, but the sticky feeling leaves pretty quickly after putting it on your skin. It also has a slight cooling effect. It leaves your skin feeling hydrated, silky and wonderful. I love using this as a daily moisturizing treatment before my makeup. It goes on fast and dries quickly, so it doesn't take much to add it to your daily routine.<br /><br />I also had to do the refrigerator test. Since this gel already had a cooling effect, I knew that it would feel amazing under my eyes after being cooled in the refrigerator. I was right! Since I am pretty tolerant to cold, I don't even mind applying it to my entire face when it is chilled.<br /><br />Since I started using this gel, I feel that my skin under my eyes looks better. It seems less puffy and saggy looking. I actually look like I get the proper amount of sleep! I have not had any irritation, breakouts or problems from using this product. Only a small amount is needed for application. I used this around my eyes, as well as over my whole face. Gently pat it around the eye area and if there is extra, smooth it above brow line and over the small area between the brows which is prone to hold wrinkles. There is a very small, light scent that disappears once absorbed. Once applied the gel is cooling and soothing. Immediately, fine lines are smoothed and skin looks and feels hydrated. Once again, Hyaluronic Acid is the key ingredient to help moisturize and retain moisture in the skin. It is aided in doing this by the Matrixyl 3000 and MSM. Continued use kept my skin radiant and dewy. It is good to use this twice a day and can be worn under sunscreen and makeup. While I can't guarantee you will have exactly the same results as I had, I can definitely recommend this to boost the appearance of the thin, delicate skin around the eye area.<br /><br />I did receive this product to test and review. It absorbs rather fast and you can feel the skin under your eyes tightening right away. It was the gel, clumping up with the foundation and peeling off like half-dried glue.   1319. Let me begin by saying that I am 28 years old and have had some fairly noticeable under eye circles for the past few years. I used to work third shift for about a year and a half and I really struggled with taking care of my skin the way I was supposed to. I was pretty much a zombie during the day and I was lucky if I got six hours of sleep each night! I have become more concerned with my skincare routine over the last couple of years, especially since 30 is right around the corner.<br /><br />The Product: The way this product is dispensed is really nice. It's a nice pump that distributes a rather hefty amount in just one go. I've come to only use about half a pump for my entire face and it seems to be plenty for my skin. I think this bottle will last me at least a couple of months, so the price is very reasonable. As far as the consistency goes, it's similar to a gel shaving cream, but maybe a little more lightweight. It did not weigh my skin down at all, but it was a little shiny immediately after the application. After it's soaked in, I only had a little sheen to my face, which actually just made my skin look more dewy.<br /><br />The results: My skin LOVES this stuff. I do let it soak in for a few minutes before applying an oil free lotion moisturizer on top and it's applied both morning and night, which is the recommendation on the back of the bottle. I noticed a difference in my under eye area immediately after applying this. Now, I research a product thoroughly and read numerous reviews before actually making a purchase, so I had absolutely no expectations going into this. I like to be realistic, no matter what the other reviews said. Did I expect to see results right away? Absolutely not. But I noticed that my under eye area immediately seemed brighter and that area of skin literally drank this stuff up. I don't have to use hardly any under eye concealer now, which saves me time and money. I have also started to notice a nice vertical wrinkle line down the center of my forehead that meets right in between my eyebrows (I'm near sighted, so I've squinted pretty much my entire life), as well as the very beginnings of crow's feet on the outer parts of my eyes, so I apply this pretty much all over the face, including the eyelids themselves. My eyelids have become brighter and more even toned as well.<br /><br />Verdict: I don't think is a miracle product, because I don't believe such a thing exists, but I am absolutely impressed with this product so far and cannot wait to see how my skin looks with continued use.<br /><br />Buy. This. NOW.

  1520. Not only is the package HUGE for an eye gel - a teeny tiny bit can go a long way. The easy to use pump is great, but I only need to depress it about 1/4 the way down to get the amount I need for my undereyes AND I still have enough product left to dab on other trouble spots on my face and neck. This is a non-irritating, cooling, refreshing clear/cloudy gel that smells faintly of cucumbers which only adds to the spa-like feeling of using it. The product literally glides on and absorbs quickly into the delicate undereye skin. It feels succulent, water-based, definitely not oily or greasy at all. I would use this all over my face if I had really thin, sensitive skin - or if I had really oily skin and didn't want an oil-based serum sitting on top of an oil slick. This reminds me of the oil-free product lines that carry gel moisturizers to help balance and soothe your skin. The bottle is big enough that you wouldn't be running out quickly if you used it on more than your undereyes.

A little goes a long way - about the size of a small pea covers both under eye areas. The eye gel is not sticky or leaves any feeling of a coating on my skin. This eye gel does not allow my eye makeup (mascara or eye liner) to smear - a real problem with most brands. But most important, the fines lines and wrinkles around my eyes are less noticeable. It has begun to address the dark circles too.
